text: Dennis "Denny" Green (February 17, 1949 - July 22, 2016) was a head coach for the Minnesota Vikings and Arizona Cardinals, in the National Football League. He also coached college football for Northwestern University and Stanford University. He was born in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania. == Interview == After the Cardinals' loss to the Chicago Bears in 2006, Green erupted in an angry interview, because the Cardinals were winning by 20 points first, but then the Bears came back and won, with the Cardinals kicker Neil Rackers missing the game-winning field goal. == Death == Green died suddenly of a massive heart attack in Minneapolis, Minnesota on July 22, 2016, aged 67. == Head coaching records == Minnesota Vikings (NFL) 1992-2001 Reg season Playoffs Year W L T W L 1992 11 5 0 0 1 1993 9 7 0 0 1 1994 10 6 0 0 1 1995 8 8 0 0 0 1996 9 7 0 0 1 1997 9 7 0 1 1 1998 15 1 0 1 1 1999 10 6 0 1 1 2000 11 5 0 1 1 2001 5 10 0 0 0 Arizona Cardinals (NFL) 2004-2006 Reg season Playoffs Year W L T W L 2004 6 10 0 0 0 2005 5 11 0 0 0 2006 5 11 0 0 0 == References == == Other websites == * Green's official website * 2006 Northwestern Football Media Guide (History) * 2006 Stanford Football Media Guide (History) Category:1949 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:National Football League coaches Category:People from Harrisburg, Pennsylvania Category:College football coaches
title: Dennis Green
